sen.j: 平 親宗（たいら の ちかむね、天養元年(1144年) - 正治元年7月17日 (旧暦)(1199年8月10日)）は平安時代末期の公卿。
sen.e: TAIRA no Chikamune (1144 - August 10, 1199) was a court noble in the end of Heian Period.
TAIRA no Chikamune (1144 - August 10, 1199) was a court noble in the end of Heian Period.
TAIRA no Chikamune (1144 - August 10, 1199) was a court noble in the end of Heian Period.
He was a second son of TAIRA no Tokinobu.
He was the second son of TAIRA no Tokinobu.
He was the second son of TAIRA no Tokinobu.
His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Mototaka.
His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Mototaka.
His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Mototaka.
His last official title was Shonii (Senior Second Rank)・Chunagon (Middle Counselor).
His last official title was Shonii (Senior Second Rank)・Chunagon (Middle Counselor).
His last official title was Shonii (Senior Second Rank)・Chunagon (vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 「数字不一致確認済み」中納言の定訳

sen.j: 異母兄弟姉妹に平時子・平時忠・平滋子らがあり、子に親国・平親長・宗宣らがある。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tokiko, TAIRA no Tokitada and TAIRA no Shigeko were his half brother/sister with the same father and Chikakuni, TAIRA no Chikanaga and Munenobu were his children.
TAIRA no Tokiko, TAIRA no Tokitada and TAIRA no Shigeko were his half brother/sister with the same father and Chikakuni, TAIRA no Chikanaga and Munenobu were his children.
TAIRA no Tokiko, TAIRA no Tokitada and TAIRA no Shigeko were his half brother/sister with the same father and Chikakuni, TAIRA no Chikanaga and Munenobu were his children.

sen.j: 平清盛の縁戚につながる一人でありながら、異母兄の時忠と年齢が離れていたこともあり、平氏の勢力拡大時においても一貫して後白河法皇の側にあった。
sen.e: Although he was a relative of TAIRA no Kiyomori, he consistently sided with the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa even during the period when Heishi (Taira clan) was increasing its power probably because he was far younger than Tokitada, his half older brother with the same father.

Although he was a relative of TAIRA no Kiyomori, he consistently sided with the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa even during the period when Heishi (Taira clan) was increased its power probably because he was far younger than Tokitada, his half older brother with the same father.

Although he was a relative of TAIRA no Kiyomori, he consistently sided with the Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa even during the period when Heishi (Taira clan) was increased its power probably because he was far younger than Tokitada, his half older brother with the same father.

sen.j: 法皇が江口遊女に生ませた第九皇子・承仁法親王（第63代天台座主）の養育にあたるなど絶大な信頼を得た。
sen.e: He gained the Cloistered Emperor's enormous trust through his job of rearing the ninth prince, the priestly Imperial Prince Shonin, who was born between the Cloistered Emperor and Eguchi yujo (a prostitute).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He gained the Cloistered Emperor's enormous trust through his job of rearing the ninth prince, the priestly Imperial Prince Shonin, who was born between the Cloistered Emperor and Eguchi yujo (a prostitute).

He gained the Cloistered Emperor's enormous trust through his job of rearing the ninth prince, the Cloistered Imperial Prince Shonin (the 63rd Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect)), who was born between the Cloistered Emperor and Eguchi yujo (a prostitute).
sen.cmt: 「数字不一致確認済み」法親王の訳、変更（第63代天台座主） 追記

sen.j: しかしながら、そのために治承三年の政変で、院の近臣の一人として右中弁の職を解かれている。
sen.e: Due to such relations with the Cloistered Emperor, however, he was removed, along with other close aides of the Cloistered Emperor, from the position of Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) by the Coup of the Third Year of Jisho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Due to such relations with the Cloistered Emperor, however, he was removed, along with other close aides of the Cloistered Emperor, from the position of Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) by the Coup of the Third Year of Jisho.

Due to such relations with the Cloistered Emperor, however, he was removed, along with other close aides of the Cloistered Emperor, from the position of Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right) by the Coup of the Third Year of Jisho.

sen.j: こうした経緯により、寿永2年(1183年)に平氏一門が都落ちした際にも随行せず、そのまま都に止まった。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, he didn't follow and remained in the capital when the people of TAIRA clan exiled themselves from the capital in 1183.
Under such circumstances, he didn't follow and remained in the capital when the people of TAIRA clan exiled themselves from the capital in 1183.
Under such circumstances, he didn't follow and remained in the capital when the people of TAIRA clan exiled themselves from the capital in 1183.

sen.j: 平氏滅亡後、源頼朝と源義経が対立を深めると、高階泰経、平知康らとともに義経支持派として頼朝から弾劾され、再び解官の憂き目に合っている。
sen.e: When the confrontation between MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune became serious after the collapse of TAIRA clan, he was censured by Yoritomo, along with TAKASHINA no Yasutsune and TAIRA no Tomoyasu, for supporting Yoshitsune and was removed from office once again.

When the confrontation between MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune turned serious after the collapse of TAIRA clan, he was censured by Yoritomo, along with TAKASHINA no Yasutsune and TAIRA no Tomoyasu, for supporting Yoshitsune and was removed from office once again.

When the confrontation between MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune turned serious after the collapse of TAIRA clan, he was censured by Yoritomo, along with TAKASHINA no Yasutsune and TAIRA no Tomoyasu, for supporting Yoshitsune and was removed from office once again.

sen.j: 最終的には正治元年（1199年）に中納言に進み、これを極官として同年逝去。
sen.e: Eventually, he was promoted to Chunagon, which was his highest post, in 1199 and died in the same year.
Eventually, he was promoted to Chunagon, which was his highest post, in 1199 and died in the same year.
Eventually, he was promoted to Chunagon, which was his highest post, in 1199 and died in the same year.

sen.j: 平氏一門の中では平重盛一家に近かったとされ、娘の一人は重盛の長男平維盛の側室になっている。
sen.e: It is believed that he was close to TAIRA no Shigemori family inside the TAIRA clan and one of his daughters became a concubine of TAIRA no Koremori, Shigemori's eldest son.
It is believed that he was close to the TAIRA no Shigemori family inside the TAIRA clan and one of his daughters became a concubine of TAIRA no Koremori, Shigemori's eldest son.
It is believed that he was close to the TAIRA no Shigemori family inside the TAIRA clan and one of his daughters became a concubine of TAIRA no Koremori, Shigemori's eldest son.

sen.j: また別の娘は太政大臣西園寺公経との間に左大臣西園寺実雄を産んでいる。
sen.e: Between Dajo Daijin (Grand Minister) Kintsune SAIONJI, his another daughter gave birth to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Saneo SAIONJI.
Between Dajo Daijin (Grand Minister) Kintsune SAIONJI, his other daughter gave birth to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Saneo SAIONJI.
Between Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) Kintsune SAIONJI, his other daughter gave birth to Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Saneo SAIONJI.

sen.j: 家集として『中納言親宗集』がある。
sen.e: "Chunagon Chikamune Shu (a collection of Middle Counselor Chikamune)" is his private anthology.
"Chunagon Chikamune Shu (a collection of Middle Counselor Chikamune)" is his private anthology.
"Chunagon Chikamune Shu (a collection of vice-councilor of state, Chikamune)" is his private anthology.

sen.j: また日記として『親宗卿記』を書き遺している。
sen.e: He also wrote his diary "Chikamunekyo Ki (a diary of Lord Chikamune)".
He also wrote a diary entitled "Chikamunekyo Ki (a diary of Lord Chikamune)".
He also wrote a diary entitled "Chikamunekyo Ki (a diary of Lord Chikamune)".
